Chihuly: Through the Looking Glass at the MFA in Boston

Let’s go see the Chihuly: Through the Looking Glass Art exhibit at the MFA on 7/27. I have yet to see the exhibit and there won't be much time to see it before it moves away.

Admission to the MFA includes includes seeing the Chihuly: Through the Looking Glass exhibit so you dont need separate admission. Wednesday nights are voluntary contribution for admission. Please do contribute to the MFA.

Let's meet at the back entrance (State Street Corporation - Fenway Entrance - See Map). I heard it is less crowded from there. We will meet outside at the stairs.

Following seeing the exhibit, we can go out for dinner at a place to eat in the area.

http://www.mfa.org/sites/default/files/imagecache/showcase_2/images/parkingmap.jpg

 

Here's some information about the exhibit from MFA website:

"Glass and light create a world of wonder
Over the course of his career, Dale Chihuly has revolutionized the art of blown glass, moving it into the realm of large-scale sculpture and establishing the use of glass—inherently a fragile but also magical material—as a vehicle for installation and environmental art. This exhibition of new and archival works represents the breadth and scope of the artist’s creative vision over the last four decades.

The exhibition will include installations such as Lime Green Icicle Tower, to be installed in the Shapiro Courtyard; a Persian Wall; a Chandelier room with six examples, including the Chiostro di Sant’Apollonia Chandelier; and a room containing a magnificent Mille Fiori installation that is nearly sixty feet long."

Check out info about the exhibit:

http://www.mfa.org/exhibitions/chihuly

 

It's probably easiest to take the T there, but for those who have to park, there is parking around MFA (see link) or street metered parking:

http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here/parking
